description: Giants tower over humans and their kind. They are humanlike in shape, though some have multiple heads or deformities. The six varieties of true giants—hill, stone, frost, fire, cloud, and storm—represent the most potent and numerous of the giant races.

traits.name: Keen Smell
traits.description: The giant has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on smell.

traits.name: Innate Spellcasting
traits.description: The giant's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma. It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components: At will: Detect Magic, Fog Cloud, Light. 3/day each: Feather Fall, Fly, Misty Step, Telekinesis. 1/day each: Control Weather, Gaseous Form.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.description: The giant makes two morningstar attacks.

actions.name: Morningstar
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +12 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 21 (3d8+8) piercing damage.

actions.name: Rock
actions.description: Ranged Weapon Attack: +12 to hit, range 60/240 ft., one target. Hit: 30 (4d10+8) bludgeoning damage.

traits.name: Stone Camouflage
traits.description: The giant has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks made to hide in rocky terrain.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.description: The giant makes two greatclub attacks.

actions.name: Greatclub
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. Hit: 19 (3d8+6) bludgeoning damage.

actions.name: Rock
actions.description: Ranged Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, range 60/240 ft., one target. Hit: 28 (4d10+6) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 17 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.

reactions.name: Rock Catching
reactions.description: If a rock or similar object is hurled at the giant, the giant can, with a successful DC 10 Dexterity saving throw, catch the missile and take no bludgeoning damage from it.

traits.name: Amphibious
traits.description: The giant can breathe air and water.

traits.name: Innate Spellcasting
traits.description: The giant's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 17). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components: At will: Detect Magic, Feather Fall, Levitate, Light. 3/day each: Control Weather, Water Breathing.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.description: The giant makes two greatsword attacks.

actions.name: Greatsword
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +14 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 30 (6d6+9) slashing damage.

actions.name: Rock
actions.description: Ranged Weapon Attack: +14 to hit, range 60/240 ft., one target. Hit: 35 (4d12+9) bludgeoning damage.

actions.name: Lightning Strike (Recharge 5-6)
actions.description: The giant hurls a magical lightning bolt at a point it can see within 500 feet of it. Each creature within 10 feet of that point must make a DC 17 Dexterity saving throw, taking 54 (12d8) lightning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

actions.name: Greatclub
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 13 (2d8+4) bludgeoning damage.

actions.name: Javelin
actions.description: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 30/120 ft., one target. Hit: 11 (2d6+4) piercing damage.

traits.name: Keen Smell
traits.description: The troll has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on smell.

traits.name: Regeneration
traits.description: The troll regains 10 hit points at the start of its turn. If the troll takes acid or fire damage, this trait doesn't function at the start of the troll's next turn. The troll dies only if it starts its turn with 0 hit points and doesn't regenerate.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.description: The troll makes three attacks: one with its bite and two with its claws.

actions.name: Bite
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d6+4) piercing damage.

actions.name: Claw
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 11 (2d6+4) slashing damage.

traits.name: Two Heads
traits.description: The ettin has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks and on saving throws against being blinded, charmed, deafened, frightened, stunned, and knocked unconscious.

traits.name: Wakeful
traits.description: When one of the ettin's heads is asleep, its other head is awake.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.description: The ettin makes two attacks: one with its battleaxe and one with its morningstar.

actions.name: Battleaxe
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 14 (2d8+5) slashing damage.

actions.name: Morningstar
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 14 (2d8+5) piercing damage.

traits.name: Poor Depth Perception
traits.description: The cyclops has disadvantage on any attack roll against a target more than 30 feet away.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.description: The cyclops makes two greatclub attacks.

actions.name: Greatclub
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 19 (3d8+6) bludgeoning damage.

actions.name: Rock
actions.description: Ranged Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, range 30/120 ft., one target. Hit: 28 (4d10+6) bludgeoning damage.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.description: The fomorian attacks twice with its greatclub or makes one greatclub attack and uses Evil Eye once.

actions.name: Greatclub
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. Hit: 19 (3d8+6) bludgeoning damage.

actions.name: Evil Eye
actions.description: The fomorian magically forces a creature it can see within 60 feet of it to make a DC 14 Charisma saving throw. The creature takes 27 (6d8) psychic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

actions.name: Curse of the Evil Eye (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
actions.description: With a stare, the fomorian uses Evil Eye, but on a failed save, the creature is also cursed with magical deformities. While cursed, the creature has its speed halved and has disadvantage on ability checks, saving throws, and attacks based on Strength or Dexterity. The cursed creature can repeat the saving throw whenever it finishes a long rest, ending the effect on a success.

traits.name: Soul Jar
traits.description: The giant carries a soul jar, a vessel holding the souls of creatures the giant has slain. The giant can use a bonus action to consume a soul from the jar, regaining 21 (6d6) hit points. The jar contains 1d6 souls when encountered.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.description: The giant makes two Reaping Scythe attacks or one Reaping Scythe attack and uses Soul Reap.

actions.name: Reaping Scythe
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +13 to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. Hit: 24 (3d10+8) slashing damage plus 11 (2d10) necrotic damage.

actions.name: Soul Reap
actions.description: The giant targets one creature it can see within 60 feet of it. The target must make a DC 16 Constitution saving throw, taking 35 (10d6) necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. If this damage reduces the target to 0 hit points, the target dies, and its soul is trapped in the giant's soul jar.

actions.name: Rock
actions.description: Ranged Weapon Attack: +13 to hit, range 60/240 ft., one target. Hit: 30 (4d10+8) bludgeoning damage.

traits.name: Siege Monster
traits.description: The ogre deals double damage to objects and structures.

actions.name: Bash
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 15 (2d10+4) bludgeoning damage, and the target must succeed on a DC 14 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.

actions.name: Block the Path
actions.description: Until the start of the ogre's next turn, attack rolls against the ogre have disadvantage, it has advantage on the attack roll it makes for an opportunity attack, and that attack deals an extra 16 (3d10) bludgeoning damage on a hit. Also, each enemy that tries to move out of the ogre's reach without teleporting must succeed on a DC 14 Strength saving throw or have its speed reduced to 0 until the start of the ogre's next turn.

actions.name: Fist
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 9 (2d4+4) bludgeoning damage.

actions.name: Bolt Launcher
actions.description: Ranged Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, range 120/480 ft., one target. Hit: 17 (3d10+1) piercing damage.

actions.name: Fist
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 9 (2d4+4) bludgeoning damage.

actions.name: Chain Sweep
actions.description: The ogre swings its chain, and every creature within 10 feet of it must make a DC 14 Dexterity saving throw. On a failed saving throw, a creature takes 8 (1d8+4) bludgeoning damage and is knocked prone. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage and isn't knocked prone.

actions.name: Chain Smash
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 13 (2d8+4) bludgeoning damage, and the target must succeed on a DC 14 Constitution saving throw or be stunned until the start of the ogre's next turn.
